Articles.Content:
Hi,

Was hoping there might be a mod that would do this, but I would like to be able to jettison extra resources.

Example: bringing a spaceplane with a RAPIER engine back to kerbin, and jettisoning unnecessary oxidizer to help with CoM.

I know a little bit of C#, so I might make a mod myself that adds this function, but any chance anyone's done this already? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
I believe Ship Manifest allows you to dump resources (by type or from specific tanks).

> 
> I believe Ship Manifest allows you to dump resources (by type or from specific tanks).

Right on, I might give that a try. Thanks! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

One thing I forgot to mention, though: I'd prefer it not be attached to some other giant RAM-hogging mod. Ship Manifest doesn't look *too* bad, but IMO, the smaller the better.

Ship Manifest isn't bad.

Most single part mods will take up more RAM than any mod without parts.

> 
> Ship Manifest isn't bad.
> Most single part mods will take up more RAM than any mod without parts.

Good to know. I'll keep that in mind! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
TAC Fuel Balancer allows this as well.

> 
> TAC Fuel Balancer allows this as well.

A-ha! Now *that's* more like it. No extra fluff ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Thanks!
[Smart Parts](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/64227) has a fuel valve to drain excess resources. I heavily use the altimeter and timer parts.
